item.title: Integrated Shortcodes
item.dc:creator: churchopewp
item.content:encoded:
SHORTCODES ARE INTEGRATED
IN THE DEFAULT EDITOR

You dont need to remember all these shortcodes anymore! They are now integrated in default editor and you can add any of them in just a couple of clicks.

EVERY SHORTCODE HAS ITS OWN SETTINGS
THAT ARE SIMPLE FOR UNDERSTANDING

LIST OF SHORTCODES

[one_half]
  • Pricing plans
  • Buttons
  • Tabs & Toggles
  • Audio Player
  • Events
  • Contact Form
[/one_half] [one_half last=last]
  • Galleries
  • Message Boxes
  • Columns
  • Social
  • Teasers
  • Blog
[/one_half]

item.title: Custom Widgets
item.dc:creator: churchopewp
item.content:encoded:
WE GOT ALL YOU NEED!

We tried to add all kind of stuff that may be ever need for your website.

This theme comes with 11 custom widgets, such as: social links, contact form, flickr, from portfolio/gallery, twitter, email subscribe, upcoming events, next event countdown, recent posts, popular posts, testimonials to make your life easier.


 

EACH WIDGET COMES WITH VARIOUS OPTIONS FOR BETTER FLEXIBILITY

item.title: Translation ready
item.dc:creator: churchopewp
item.content:encoded:
YOU CAN EASILY TRANSLATE IT
TO ANY LANGUAGE

This theme is ready to be translated in other languages than English. It include a .POT file,
from which can be easily created .po/.mo files in the language you need.

MAKE IT MULTILINGUAL WITH WPML

WPLM makes it easy to run a multilingual website with a single WordPress install. Choose languages for your site and start translating content. You can arrange different language contents in the same domain (in language directories), in sub-domains or in completely different domains. Learn more about WPML

item.title: One Click Install
item.dc:creator: churchopewp
item.content:encoded:
[one_half] [/one_half] [one_half last=last]

IT IS EXTREMELY EASY
TO INSTALL

You will love this theme from the first steps! With our One click install feature you can setup this theme with the same look as on preview in just a couple of clicks. * Images from preview are not included [/one_half] [clear]

[one_half]

ALL YOU NEED TO DO IS

1. Install and activate our theme. Dashboard -> Appearance -> Themes -> Install Themes -> Upload. 2. Go to Dashboard -> Theme Options -> Dummy Content and click install dummy data. That's All! [/one_half] [one_half last=last] [/one_half]

item.title: Unlimited colors
item.dc:creator: churchopewp
item.content:encoded:

YOU CAN SET ANY COLOR FOR ALMOST ANY ELEMENT USING COLOR PICKER

CONTROL EVERY PIXEL OF THIS THEME
FROM ADMIN PANEL

You can set your colors and background patterns for different areas of this theme.

item.dc:creator: churchopewp

RESPONSIVE DESIGN

This theme looks great not only on desktops but also on devices. What means that there are no special requirements for your clients to browse your website. [/two_third]

You can set different layouts, sidebar instances, custom slideshow, set items amount to display per page for tags, galleries, categories, testimonials listings.

"At vero eos et accusamus et iusto odio dignissimos ducimus qui blanditiis praesentium voluptatum deleniti atque corrupti quos dolores et quas molestias excepturi sint occaecati cupiditate non provident, similique sunt in culpa qui officia deserunt mollitia animi, id est laborum et dolorum fuga. Temporibus autem quibusdam et aut officiis debitis aut rerum necessitatibus saepe eveniet ut et voluptates repudiandae sint et molestiae non recusandae. Itaque earum rerum hic tenetur a sapiente delectus, ut aut reiciendis voluptatibus maiores alias consequatur aut perferendis doloribus asperiores repellat."   [two_third] Suspendisse porta, urna in hendrerit lobortis, mauris lorem facilisis odio, id hendrerit ante metus id est. Nullam et ipsum lectus. Curabitur id libero id elit fermentum dictum. Suspendisse tempus, ante eu fermentum congue, dolor massa hendrerit est, vel condimentum neque dolor sit amet magna. Proin pharetra, leo in placerat mollis, nibh felis feugiat mauris, eget scelerisque purus sapien at felis. Etiam malesuada sem a velit euismod tempus malesuada nunc mollis. Pellentesque a leo consectetur nibh pretium condimentum. Cras commodo aliquet elementum. Quisque id mi eget magna faucibus varius ac imperdiet turpis. Mauris vel risus non nisi molestie pretium. Aenean non ultrices sem. Vestibulum suscipit metus et tellus laoreet vel facilisis justo dictum. Donec sit amet dui purus, ac congue leo. Duis id velit justo, quis malesuada diam. Integer sed mauris ante. [/two_third] [one_third last=last] Fusce cursus ultrices tellus, in ultricies felis laoreet vel. Mauris at mauris vitae metus pretium ornare et eget velit. Nam fermentum ante sed dui tempus elementum. Donec et enim libero. Ut dictum libero ac quam imperdiet nec consectetur arcu aliquet. Suspendisse sem lacus, iaculis non luctus id, euismod et massa. Sed porttitor sem id neque dignissim mollis. Proin at mauris felis. [/one_third] [clear]  

1914 translation by H. Rackham

"On the other hand, we denounce with righteous indignation and dislike men who are so beguiled and demoralized by the charms of pleasure of the moment, so blinded by desire, that they cannot foresee the pain and trouble that are bound to ensue; and equal blame belongs to those who fail in their duty through weakness of will, which is the same as saying through shrinking from toil and pain. These cases are perfectly simple and easy to distinguish. In a free hour, when our power of choice is untrammelled and when nothing prevents our being able to do what we like best, every pleasure is to be welcomed and every pain avoided. But in certain circumstances and owing to the claims of duty or the obligations of business it will frequently occur that pleasures have to be repudiated and annoyances accepted. The wise man therefore always holds in these matters to this principle of selection: he rejects pleasures to secure other greater pleasures, or else he endures pains to avoid worse pains."

1914 translation by H. Rackham

"On the other hand, we denounce with righteous indignation and dislike men who are so beguiled and demoralized by the charms of pleasure of the moment, so blinded by desire, that they cannot foresee the pain and trouble that are bound to ensue; and equal blame belongs to those who fail in their duty through weakness of will, which is the same as saying through shrinking from toil and pain. These cases are perfectly simple and easy to distinguish. In a free hour, when our power of choice is untrammelled and when nothing prevents our being able to do what we like best, every pleasure is to be welcomed and every pain avoided. But in certain circumstances and owing to the claims of duty or the obligations of business it will frequently occur that pleasures have to be repudiated and annoyances accepted. The wise man therefore always holds in these matters to this principle of selection: he rejects pleasures to secure other greater pleasures, or else he endures pains to avoid worse pains."

TONS OF OPTIONS

to give you full control over your website!



and there are lots more inside...

item.title: Unlimited flexibility
item.dc:creator: churchopewp
item.content:encoded:
Besides the fact that you can change colors, fonts, patterns & there are a lot of custom widgets and shortcodes, you can also set
custom slideshow & layout with any sidebar instance for any page, post or taxonomies!



1. CATEGORIES

You can control layout for categories using categories settings same as for post & pages. Here is some examples of what you can do:
[button type="simple_button_link" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/category/principles/" target="" ]Full width category[/button] [button type="simple_button_link" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/category/stories/" target="" ]Category with right sidebar & custom slideshow[/button][button type="simple_button_link" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/category/church/" target="" ]Category with right sidebar[/button] [button type="simple_button_link" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/category/events/" target="" ]Full width category with slideshow[/button] [button type="simple_button_link" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/category/bible/" target="" ]Category with left sidebar[/button][clear]


2. POSTS & PAGES

You have full control over post & pages layout. Here is some examples of what you can do:
[button type="simple_button_link" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/full-width/" target="" ]Full width page[/button] [button type="simple_button_link" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/news/" target="" ]Page with right sidebar[/button] [button type="simple_button_link" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/left-sidebar/" target="" ]Page with left sidebar[/button] [button type="simple_button_black" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/post-with-custom-slideshow-full-width-layout/" target="" ]Full width post with slideshow [/button] [button type="simple_button_black" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/custom-sidebar-left-layout/" target="" ]Post with left sidebar[/button][button type="simple_button_black" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/post-with-right-sidebar-layout/" target="" ]Post with right sidebar[/button][clear]


3. GALLERY CATEGORIES & POSTS

You can control layout for gallery categories & posts using categories & post settings. Here is some examples of what you can do:
[button type="simple_button_link" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/th_gallery_cat/nature/" target="" ]Full width gallery category[/button] [button type="simple_button_link" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/th_gallery_cat/other/" target="" ]Gallery category with right sidebar & custom slideshow[/button] [button type="simple_button_black" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/big-layout-sortable-left-sidebar/" target="" ]Gallery page with left sidebar[/button][button type="simple_button_black" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/th_gallery/portfolio-post-with-slideshow/" target="" ]Gallery post with slideshow[/button] [button type="simple_button_black" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/th_gallery/video-post-with-right-sidebar/" target="" ]Gallery post with right sidebar[/button][clear]


4. EVENTS

Events made as custom post with custom settings. That allow you to control layout for events categories & posts. Here is some examples of what you can do:
[button type="simple_button_link" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/th_event/summe-meeting/" target="" ]Events post with top & right sidebars[/button] [button type="simple_button_black" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/th_event_cat/2012/7/20/" target="" ]Events list for specific day[/button]


5. TESTIMONIALS

Testimonials also made as custom post with custom settings. That allow you to control layout for testimonials categories & posts. Here is some examples of what you can do:
[button type="simple_button_link" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/th_testimonial_cat/testimonials/" target="" ]Testimonials category with right sidebar[/button] [button type="simple_button_black" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/th_testimonial/731/" target="" ]Testimonials post with left sidebar[/button] [button type="simple_button_black" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/th_testimonial/732/" target="" ]Testimonials post with slideshow[/button]

item.title: Default theme customize support, for WP 3.4
item.dc:creator: churchopewp
item.content:encoded:
ENHANCED THEME CONTROL

Starting version 3.4 of WordPress, you can customize theme options before activating a new theme using Theme Customizer.


To use this feature, go to Appearance -> Themes and click "Customize" link near your theme.

item.title: SEO by Yoast
item.dc:creator: churchopewp
item.content:encoded:
This theme supports SEO by Yoast Plugin.



What is SEO by Yoast?

WordPress SEO is the most complete WordPress SEO plugin that exists today for WordPress.org users. It incorporates everything from a snippet preview and page analysis functionality that helps you optimize your pages content, images titles, meta descriptions and more to XML sitemaps, and loads of optimization options in between.

WordPress SEO Plugin feature list

[one_half]
  • Post titles and meta descriptions
  • Robots Meta configuration
  • Canonical
  • Breadcrumbs
  • Permalink clean up
[/one_half] [one_half last=last]
  • XML Sitemaps
  • RSS enhancements
  • Edit your robots.txt and .htaccess
  • Clean up head section
  • API Docs
[/one_half] [clear]

Post titles and meta descriptions

WordPress SEO let's you set templates for titles and meta descriptions for all types of pages, so you could come up with a template and not have to think about it, or you could use the WordPress SEO meta box to completely optimize your post title and meta description, using the snippet preview functionality to see what it would look like in Google. Add to that the chance to enter a focus keyword, which is used to show you how it would bold in your search results, and you have the chance to control everything you want about your listing in Google ...

You can learn more about this plugin on official website

[button type="churchope_button" url="http://yoast.com/wordpress/seo/" target="on" ]Learn more about SEO by Yoast Plugin[/button]

There are 3 styles for buttons. You can set any color for each button style to these buttons.

item.title: Tabs & Toggles
item.dc:creator: churchopewp
item.content:encoded:
Toggles Style "White"

[toggle type="white" title="At vero eos et accusamus" active="active"]But I must explain to you how all this mistaken idea of denouncing pleasure and praising pain was born and I will give you a complete account of the system, and expound the actual teachings of the great explorer of the truth[/toggle] [toggle type="white" title="Sed ut perspiciatis"]But I must explain to you how all this mistaken idea of denouncing pleasure and praising pain was born and I will give you a complete account of the system, and expound the actual teachings of the great explorer of the truth[/toggle] [toggle type="white" title="On the other hand"]But I must explain to you how all this mistaken idea of denouncing pleasure and praising pain was born and I will give you a complete account of the system, and expound the actual teachings of the great explorer of the truth, the master-builder of human happiness. No one rejects, dislikes, or avoids pleasure itself, because it is pleasure, but because those who do not know how to pursue pleasure rationally encounter consequences that are extremely painful. Nor again is there anyone who loves or pursues or desires to obtain pain of itself, because it is pain, but because occasionally circumstances occur in which toil and pain can procure him some great pleasure. To take a trivial example, which of us ever undertakes laborious physical exercise, except to obtain some advantage from it? But who has any right to find fault with a man who chooses to enjoy a pleasure that has no annoying consequences, or one who avoids a pain that produces no resultant pleasure[/toggle]

Sample code

[toggle type="white" title="At vero eos et accusamus" active="active"]...[/toggle]
[toggle type="white" title="Sed ut perspiciatis"]...[/toggle]
[toggle type="white" title="On the other hand"]...[/toggle]

Aliquam ut risus neque, eu fringilla neque. Suspendisse potenti. Integer in diam congue diam fermentum cursus at eu lorem.[/tab] [tab title="Donec"]Aenean iaculis turpis non neque molestie cursus. item.title: Audio Player
item.dc:creator: churchopewp
item.content:encoded:
How To Add Audio Player

You can add audio the same way you add images.


Simply upload audio using add media option (Upload/Insert button above the editor) and then click "Insert into post".

[thaudio href='http://churchope.themoholics.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/07/Sunny-Morning-2.mp3']Sunny Morning[/thaudio]

Sample Code

[thaudio href='http://url/Sunny-Morning-2.mp3']Sunny Morning[/thaudio]


Flexibility

You can control player width using column shortcodes.


[two_third] [thaudio href='http://churchope.themoholics.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/07/Sunny-Morning-2.mp3' hide_title='true']Sunny Morning [/thaudio] [/two_third] [one_third last=last] [thaudio href='http://churchope.themoholics.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/07/Sunny-Morning-2.mp3' hide_title='true']Sleepy Night [/thaudio] [/one_third]

[one_fourth last=last]   [thaudio href='http://url/Sunny-Morning-2.mp3' hide_title='true']Sleepy Night [/thaudio] [/one_fourth]

Audio Title

You can add following code to shortcode to hide title & time below the timeline: 
hide_title='true'

item.title: How To Create Events
item.dc:creator: churchopewp
item.content:encoded:
[one_half] [toc title="Settings" hide="hide" show="show"]
  • Create event post
    • Repeatable events
    • Add map location
    • Event Post Layout
  • Events Settings
  • Customize events categories
  • Slideshow Settings
[/toc] [/one_half] [one_half last=last] [toc title="Output" hide="hide" show="show"]
  • Event calendar shortcode
  • Upcoming events shortcode
  • Events widgets
    • Calendar
    • Upcoming events
    • Next event countdown
[/toc] [/one_half] [clear]


[one_third]

Events

On the next image and in your dashboard you can see new menu item called "Events". This is where you can organize and setup your events. [/one_third] [two_third last=last] [/two_third] [clear]

Create Event categories

To organize events you need to create events categories. You can make it before, after or directly during the creation of the event posts. To create event category go to Events -> Event Categories
[totop] to Top [/totop]

Create Event Post

To create new event post, go to Events -> Add new
[totop] to Top [/totop]

[one_third]

Assign Event Category

On the right side you will see your events categories. You need to check in which category you want this event to be displayed.
If you dont have any categoies yet, then you need to create one. To do this click + Add New Events Category. Set Category name and press Add New Events Category
[totop] to Top [/totop] [/one_third] [two_third last=last] [/two_third] [clear]

Set Event Date

Now you need to set date & time for your event. You can find this setting below the content editor in Event date block.
[one_third]
Click on the date field and caledar will appera where you can choose the date. Or you can simply type your date and time in this fields but keep the formatting I.E.: 07/31/2012 12:00 AM This is most common issue. Note: you can change time format in Settings-> General: Time Format. [/one_third] [two_third last=last] [/two_third] [clear]
[totop] to Top [/totop]

Repeatable Event

 To make event repeatable, you need to check "Is repeating?" option. You can find it in the same Event date block. After that choose repetition interval.

[totop] to Top [/totop]

Event map

 Now you need to add event location.

Click New map. After that new options will appear.


1. Type your location and click Add button. You will see a pin with popup on the map. 2. You can edit address in popup on the map by clicking edit link directly in popup. 3. Add title for this location and press save button to save location. Now you have a location for your event.
You can edit this location at any time. To do that rollover on location title and edit link will appear.
[totop] to Top [/totop]

Additional Information

You can add additional information such as phone and address that will be used to display on event page and upcoming event widget.

[totop] to Top [/totop]

[one_half]

Set layout and sidebar for event post.

 You can set one of three possible layouts for event post: Full width, Left Sidebar and Right Sidebar. You can find this settings at the right side below the event categories. [/one_half] [one_half last=last] [/one_half] [clear] [notification type="notification_info_tiny"]If you want to have same sidebar and layout for all event posts you can set it in global event settings.[/notification]
Also there are additional widget area between the map and content. You can enable it by choosing Under title sidebar instance in Title area settings block below the editor. [notification type="notification_info_tiny"]You can learn more about layouts, sidebars and widgets here.[/notification]
[totop] to Top [/totop]

Slideshow Settings

Our theme is extremely flexible and allows to set unique slideshow, with unique settigns for each post/page or taxonomies. [notification type="notification_info_tiny"]Please note that this settings will be applied ONLY for the specific page/post, where you set it and not for the other pages/posts.[/notification] To set slideshow for specific page, scroll down to the "Slideshow options" block. 1. Choose slideshow type - here you can between our custom JCycle or Revolution slideshows. By default it is set to use global settings (global settings is set in Theme Options ->Slideshows) 2. Choose Revolution Slider (for revolution slider only) - you can create many revolution slideshows, so here you can choose which of revolution slideshows you would like to use. 2. Set slideshow category (for jCycle only) 3. and set max amount of slides for this slideshow (for jCycle only).
[totop] to Top [/totop]

[one_third] [/one_third] [two_third last=last]

Publish

Add information for your event in editor and click publish button when you are done. [/two_third] [clear] [notification type="notification_info_tiny"]You can learn how to create rockin content for your post/page here.[/notification]
[totop] to Top [/totop]


How to Show my Events?

Now when you know how to create events post you need to learn how to show your events. To show your events on site, you need to use event widgets and shortodes.
[button type="simple_button_link" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/online-documentation/event-shortcodes/" target="" ]Event Shortcodes[/button] You can also learn what is widgets and shotcodes first.
[totop] to Top [/totop]

item.title: FAQ
item.dc:creator: churchopewp
item.content:encoded:
Frequently Asked Questions


Installation & Upgrade

01. Im having trouble uploading the theme: "The package could not be installed. The theme is missing the style.css stylesheet" 02. Whats the easiest way to upgrade to the latest version? 03. Ive been trying to install the Dummy Content but when I press the button, nothing happens. What can I do?

Settings

01. How to set a page as the front page? 02. Is it possible to turn off responsiveness? 03. How do I change WordPress log in page back to default? 04. Im trying to translate this Theme, but no matter where I put the .PO and .MO I can not see my translations on the frontend. 05. How can I change the day from which my week will start in calendar? 06. How to make "News" page like in your live preview? 07. How do I set a time and date for the count down timer for next event?

Content Setup

01. How to add 'Latest Sermon:..' block between slideshow and content area? 02. At the bottom of my page it has the leave a comment box how do i rid my pages of that? 03. How to add embeded video in slideshow? 04. How to add/remove border to image? 05. I would like to create the little picture boxes like the three on the home page, how do I do that? 06. How do you use the shortcodes? 07. How to remove the events from appearing in the top header section and replace with html objects? 08. How to add a map to a page, like on your contact page? 09. How do I change the url of each page created? 10. How can I re-order the slide/gallery posts in my slideshow/gallery? 11. I have no post or page names/titles on my site. Please help! 12. How can I get Social Media Icons shortcodes to the widget area and also align them to center or right istead of left? 13. Slideshow options are not working. Please Help! 14. How to set event end time? 15. My calendar gets crazy when the mouse passes on Saturday. How can I get rid of this? 16. How do I add a download button to the audio player? 17. How to embed a @font-face to ChurcHope? 18. How to get 3 teasers on top of the sidebar and 2 articles beginning as shown on the Churchope example?

Other

01. Is there a way to separate the color of the navigation bar from the color of the slider background? 02. How do you change the link for the ribbon top right corner? 03. How to remove the ribbon from top right corner? 04. Curious about the breadcrumbs though Im not getting them on my site, and dont see an option to turn on or off. 05. Where can I find my secret API Key? 06. Where can I check the changes implemented in the theme updates? 07. How can I get refund? 08. What is the best way to create image for "Color Header Image" use?

CSS Tweaks

01. How to change the menu background color? 02. How to change the menu text color? 03. How to change the menu font size? 04. How to apply a different font just for the main menu text? 05. How can I center main menu? 06. How do I change the font to bold in the menu? 07. How to reduce top navigational menu height? 08. How to change the hover color of the dropdown menu? 09. How to remove post excerpt from 'most recent' blog shortcode on homepage? 10. I want to have the Header, the Slider and the Footer at my home page. How can I get rid of the main content area? 11. How can I make the main content area at my home page smaller? 12. How can I make the header for logo smaller/larger? 13. How can I change the color of the teaser secondary line "more info"? 14. How to remove Tags & Categories from post header? 15. How can I remove image magnification feature from the thumbnails? 16. How to change spacing in slideshow title? 17. How to change the color of "DAYS", "HR", "MIN" and "SEC" at the header Next Event countdown section? 18. How do I disable page title to appear in pages? 19. How to increase font size in theme? 20. How can I change content text line height? 21. How do I increase the font size in the pages and posts general body text? 22. Would want to increase the spacing between sentences for a easier read. 23. I am trying to make the send a message contact forms text black on the site. 24. How to change the padding around the logo? 25. I would like to add more space between the logo and the counter in the header. 26. Is there a way to move the teaser title to bottom of featured image? 27. How to change the color of the testimonial author in widget? 28. How to change the color of the buttons shortcode? 29. I need space between logo and widget. 30. How can I change the color of the call to action button on the main slider? 31. How can I adjust the padding on the slider?


Installation & Upgrade


Im having trouble uploading the theme to WordPress: "The package could not be installed. The theme is missing the style.css stylesheet"

 You need to extract downloaded archive. It contains documentation and .psd files besides the theme files.
to Top

Whats the easiest way to upgrade to the latest version?

 First of all, you need to find out what version of theme is installed. You can check it in your Dashboard -> Appereance -> Themes. If your theme version is less than v.1.9, then please download a new version of our theme:
  1. Go to downloads tab in your Themeforest account and simply download our theme again.
  2. Upload theme files via FTP.
  3. Don't forget to make a backup.
Starting Version 1.9 we have developed a new functionality to update our theme. Now you can update Churchope theme directly from your dashboard.
  1. Go to your Dashboard -> Theme Options -> Theme Updater.
  2. Fill in your ThemeForest User Account Information form.
    3. To get your Themeforest API key you need to:
    • Go to Themeforest Dashboard.
    • Click My settings tab.
    • Click API keys menu on left side of page.
    • Generate API key on this page and copy it.
  3. After that you can find Update menu item in your Dashboard and update notification icon in your admin menu.
  4. Click any of them.
  5. Scroll to Themes section and click Update Themes button.
However, update theme via FTP still works fine, you can use it if you prefer. Dont forget to make backup of your theme files before update, if you modified theme files.
to Top

Ive been trying to install the Dummy Content but when I press the button, nothing happens. What can I do?

 This may be, because:
  1. You didnt installed theme correctly.
  2. You didnt wait until it was installed.
  3. Some plugins can casue JS error. Try to turn off plugins if you have any installed.
Also try to install our theme on clean WordPress installation.
to Top


Settings


How to set a page as the front page?

 You need to set your Frontpage in Settings -> Reading
to Top

Is it possible to turn off responsiveness?

 [one_third] [/one_third] [two_third last=last]

You can tur on responsiveness from admin panel. Go to Theme Options -> General and switch "Disable responsive" to on. [/two_third] [clear]
to Top

How do I change WordPress log in page?

 You can change design of login page easily without plugins. There are a lot of tutorials on the web on how to do it, i.e.: http://shailan.com/3004/customizing-wordpress-login-page-without-plugin/ Our theme has an option to disable theme login page styling: Dashboard->Theme Options -> General -> Disable login page styling
to Top

Im trying to translate this Theme, but no matter where I put the .PO and .MO I can not see my translations on the frontend.

 You need save your translation in theme root i.e. as pt_BR.mo and after that edit wp-config.php in root of the site. Search for: define (WPLANG, pt_BR); You can learn more here: http://codex.wordpress.org/Installing_WordPress_in_Your_Language
to Top

How can I change the day from which my week will start in calendar?

 You should go to your Dashboard -> Settings -> General and set the necessary day in "Week Starts On" dropdown menu at the bottom.
[totop] to Top [/totop]

How to make "News" page like in your live preview?
  • Go to your Dashboard -> Pages -> Add new and set its title as "News".
  • Go to your Dashboard -> Settings -> Reading and select this page as your posts page.

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How do I set a time and date for the count down timer for next event?

 You should create your event first. The widget will take its settings automatically.
[totop] to Top [/totop]


Content Setup


How to add 'Latest Sermon:..' block between slideshow and content area, like on front page?

 There are additional widget area between the header and content. You can enable it by choosing Under title sidebar instance in Title area settings block below the editor on any page/post or event post. You need to create custom sidebar for this area and place there your widgets. On the Frontpage of our preview was used basic text widget with following content: 
[three_fourth]<h2>Latest Sermon: Not a Fan: The Open Invitation - February 12, 2012</h2>   [/three_fourth] [one_fourth last=last] [button type="churchope_button" url="http://themeforest.net/item/churchope-responsive-wordpress-theme/2708562" target="" ]Download Latest Sermon[/button] [/one_fourth]

to Top

At the bottom of my page it has the leave a comment box how do i rid my pages of that?

 There are Screen options tab at the top in WP admin panel. Expand it and check Discussion and Comments. After that a new metabox will appear at the bottom of the page, where you can turn off comments.
to Top

How to add embeded video in slideshow?

 Starting version 1.3 our theme has slideshow shortcode that gives you possibility to easily add video to slideshow and also provides pause/resume function. The slide ain't going to switch to the next one while video is playing. All you need to do is click on video shortcode button/icon, at the editor panel in visual mode, and paste your url in popup:
Sample code of slide with video: 
[one_half]
<h3 class="entry-title">YOUTUBE, VIMEO OR SELFHOSTED VIDEOS</h3>
Sed ut perspiciatis unde omnis iste natus error sit voluptatem accusantium doloremque laudantium, totam rem aperiam, eaque ipsa quae ab illo inventore veritatis et quasi architecto beatae vitae dicta sunt explicabo. Nemo enim ipsam voluptatem quia voluptas sit aspernatur aut odit aut fugit.
[/one_half]
[one_half last=last][thvideo w="100%" h="260px"]http://player.vimeo.com/video/34783883[/thvideo] [/one_half]
[notification type="notification_info_tiny"]This shortcode works only for slideshow posts.[/notification]
to Top

How to add/remove border to image?

 If you add image using standart WordPress uploader it will be inserted into post with frame. To remove this frame you need to switch to HTML mode in editor and remove this class: imgborder Example of an image with frame:
<img src="http://churchope.themoholics.com/.../sample.jpg" alt="" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-1805 imgborder" />
If you need to add frame to image, add class imgborder. Another example of an image with frame:
<img src="http://churchope.themoholics.com/.../sample.jpg" alt="" class="imgborder" />

to Top

I would like to create the little picture boxes like the three on the home page, how do I do that?

 Three boxes on front page is a teaser shortcodes. When you edit page/post switch to visual mode and youll see shortcode buttons(icons) on editor panel. Click on teaser shortcode button. Popup with options will appear. There are two ways to make teaser: 1. Using post/page: Choose a template. In this case it will use post title and featured image for teaser title and image. 2. Using direct link to image Type your image URL here. Check this page to see how teaser shortcode should look like: http://churchope.themoholics.com/shortcodes/teasers/
to Top

How do you use the shortcodes?

 There a shotcode buttons/icons in visual mode when you edit post/page. Simply click the one you need. Youll see popup with different option for diferent shortcodes. Check this page: http://churchope.themoholics.com/shortcodes/
to Top

How to remove the events from appearing in the top header section and replace with html objects?

 It is additional widget area in header. Go to Appearance -> Widgets, seach for "Header sidebar" at the right side, remove events countodwn widget and drag in widget that you need from the left side.
to Top

How to add a map to a page, like on your contact page?

 You can find New map button just below the editor when you edit page.
Note: This feature was added in version 1.3 of our theme.
to Top

How do I change the url of each page created?

 You can do it in two ways:
  • Go to Dashboard->Pages->All Pages, click "Quick Edit" and edit the "Slug" field.
  • Go to a single page and click the "Edit" button just under the title field.

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How can I re-order the slide/gallery posts in my slideshow/gallery?

 You should edit publish time or date of your slideshow/gallery post.
[totop] to Top [/totop]

I have no post or page names/titles on my site. Please help!

 Title is not displayed when the slideshow is setup on the post/page because it covers the same area.
[totop] to Top [/totop]

How can I get Social Media Icons shortcodes to the widget area and also align them to center or right istead of left?
  1. Go to the editing area of your page/post and place the necessary social medias between the 
    <div style="text-align:right"> ...here... </div>
    tags using shortcodes.
  2. Go to Dashboard -> Appearance -> Widgets and drag the "Text" widget to necessary sidebar at the right of the page.
  3. Copy & paste the resulting code to the "Text" widget and click "Save".

[totop] to Top [/totop]

Slideshow options are not working. Please Help!

 Make sure that you make them in a proper way:
  1. You can set global slideshow at your Dashboard -> Theme Options -> Slideshows
  2. Or single page slideshow at a certain page in the "Slideshow Options" block, which you can find scrolling down the page. You can learn here "How to Add Slideshow to specific page/post".
  3. Also check the permissions of your wordpress files. They should be 644(files), 755(directories).

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How to set event end time?

 You can see events functionality in our documentaion: http://churchope.themoholics.com/online-documentation/how-to-events/ We are currently working on a complicated events system plugin but it will be available (maybe in a month or two) as a separate product. Making a proper event system requires no less effort than creating a theme.
[totop] to Top [/totop]

My calendar gets crazy when the mouse passes on Saturday. How can I get rid of this?

 Most likely, you have zoomed page in your browser. Try to press ctrl+0.
[totop] to Top [/totop]

How do I add a download button to the audio player?

 Please check this topic: http://help.themoholics.com/discussion/comment/1094#Comment_1094
[totop] to Top [/totop]

How to embed a @font-face to ChurcHope?

 Please check this topic: http://help.themoholics.com/discussion/545/how-to-embed-a-font-face-to-churchope#Item_6
[totop] to Top [/totop]

How to get 3 teasers on top of the sidebar and 2 articles beginning as shown on the Churchope example?

 Please check this topic: http://help.themoholics.com/discussion/612/how-to-get-3-teasers-on-top-of-the-sidebar-and-2-articles-beguining-as-shown-on-the-churchope-exempl#Item_2
[totop] to Top [/totop]


Other


Is there a way to separate the color of the navigation bar from the color of the slider background?

 Add next CSS rule to Dashboard->Theme options->Custom Styles 
.mainmenu {background-color:green}

to Top

How do you change the link for the ribbon top right corner?

 You can find it at Dashboard->Theme Options->Header: "Call to action header ribbon URL".
to Top

How to remove the ribbon from top right corner?

 Go to Dashboard->Theme Options->Header: and make "Call to action header ribbon URL" field completely empty, even without spaces!
to Top

Curious about the breadcrumbs though Im not getting them on my site, and dont see an option to turn on or off.

 We decided to use this must have plugin for breadcrumbs: http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wordpress-seo/ You can activate breadcrumbs on Internal links page of this plugin. This plugin is free and have a lot of nice features, so we recommend to use it.
to Top

Where can I find my secret API Key?

 You should follow this link: Envanto Knowledgebase
[totop] to Top [/totop]

Where can I check the changes implemented in the theme updates?

 You can check updates list at the very bottom of the product page.
[totop] to Top [/totop]

How can I get refund?

 We are only the authors on envato marketplace. We only provide technical support for our themes. All questions regarding billing, refund etc should be addressed to envato support: http://support.envato.com/ You can also check their knowledgebase: http://support.envato.com/index.php?/Knowledgebase/Article/View/256/0/can-i-get-a-refund-for-an-item-i-have-purchased. It is not easy to receive refund, because there should be a good reason. So we suggest you to ask presale questions first to make sure that this theme will work for you, instead of asking for refund in future.
[totop] to Top [/totop]

What is the best way to create image for "Color Header Image" use?

 Try to use a JPEG type of image with a low quality - around 40-50. You can follow this link for more information.
[totop] to Top [/totop]


CSS Tweaks


How to change the menu background color?

 Add following code in Theme Options -> Custom Styles: 
.mainmenu {background-color:#ffffff}

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How to change the menu text color?

 Add following code in Theme Options -> Custom Styles: 
.sf-menu > li > a {color:#0076C7}

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How to change the menu font size?

 Add following code in Theme Options -> Custom Styles: 
.sf-menu > li > a  {font-size:20px}

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How to apply a different font just for the main menu text?

 Add following code in Theme Options -> Custom Styles: 
.sf-menu > li > a {font-family:Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif;}

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How can I center main menu?

 Add following code in Theme Options -> Custom Styles: 
.main_menu {float:none!important}
.main_menu .sf-menu {margin:0 auto;display:table}

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How do I change the font to bold in the menu?

 Add following code in Theme Options -> Custom Styles: 
.main_menu {
font-weight: 700;
}

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How to reduce top navigational menu height?

 Add next rules to your custom styles: 
.main_menu { min-height: 20px; height: 40px; }
.sf-menu > li, .sf-menu > li > a { height: 38px; }
.sf-menu > li:hover > ul, .sf-menu > li.sfHover > ul { top: 38px; }

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How to change the hover color of the dropdown menu?

 Add next rule to your custom styles: 
.sf-menu ul li:hover, .sf-menu ul li.sfHover { background: red; }

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How to remove post excerpt from 'most recent' blog shortcode on homepage?

 Add next rule to your custom styles: 
.home .entry-content p { display: none; }

[totop] to Top [/totop]

I want to have the Header, the Slider and the Footer at my home page. How can I get rid of the main content area?

 Add next rules to your custom styles: 
.home #main, .home #sticky-footer-push { display: none; }

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How can I make the main content area at my home page smaller?

 Add next rules to your custom styles: 
.home #main { padding-bottom: 10px; padding-top: 23px; }

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How can I make the header for logo smaller/larger?

 Add next rules to your custom styles: 
.header_top { margin-top: -35px; margin-bottom: -32px; }
or 
.header_top { padding-top: 20px; padding-bottom: 20px; }

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How can I change the color of the teaser secondary line "more info"?

 Add next rule to your custom styles: 
.teaser_more { background-color: green !important; }

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How to remove Tags & Categories from post header?

 Add next rule to your custom styles: 
.blogtitles p { display: none; }

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How can I remove image magnification feature from the thumbnails?

 Add next rule to your custom styles: 
.imghover { display: none; }

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How to change spacing in slideshow title?

 Add next rule to your custom styles: 
.cycle_content h3.entry-title { line-height: 1.3em; }

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How to change the color of "DAYS", "HR", "MIN" and "SEC" at the header Next Event countdown section?

 Add next rules to your custom styles: 
header .grid_6 .widget_event li .descr { color: red; opacity: 1; }

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How do I disable page title to appear in pages?

 Add following code in Theme Options -> Custom Styles: 
#pagetitle {
display: none;
}

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How to increase font size in theme?

 Add following code in Theme Options -> Custom Styles: 
body {font-size:20px}

[totop] to Top [/totop]

And how can I change content text line height?

 Add following code in Theme Options -> Custom Styles: 
.entry-content {line-height:150%}

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How do I increase the font size in the pages and posts general body text?

 Add following code in Theme Options -> Custom Styles: 
.entry-content {font-size:20px}

[totop] to Top [/totop]

Would want to increase the spacing between sentences for a easier read.

 Add following code in Theme Options -> Custom Styles: 
#main .grid_8 h6, #main .grid_12 h6 {
line-height: 150%;
word-spacing:10px;
}

[totop] to Top [/totop]

I am trying to make the send a message contact forms text black on the site.

 Add following code in Theme Options -> Custom Styles: 
input::-webkit-input-placeholder, select::-webkit-input-placeholder, textarea::-webkit-input-placeholder {
    color:    black;
}
input:-moz-placeholder, select:-moz-placeholder, textarea:-moz-placeholder {
    color:    black;
}
input:-ms-input-placeholder, select:-ms-input-placeholder, textarea:-ms-input-placeholder {
    color:    black;
}

input, select, textarea {
    color:    black;
}

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How to change the padding around the logo?

 Add following code in Theme Options -> Custom Styles: 
.logo span, .logo img {
padding: 15px 0;
}

[totop] to Top [/totop]

I would like to add more space between the logo and the counter in the header.

 Add following code in Theme Options -> Custom Styles: 
header .widget-title, header .expiration-timer { float: right !important; }

[totop] to Top [/totop]

Is there a way to move the teaser title to bottom of featured image?

 Add following code in Theme Options -> Custom Styles: 
.teaser_title {top:50%}

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How to change the color of the testimonial author in widget?

 Add following code in Theme Options -> Custom Styles: 
.testimonial_author {color:red !important}

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How to change the color of the buttons shortcode?

 Add following code in Theme Options -> Custom Styles: 
.churchope_button {background-color:greean}

[totop] to Top [/totop]

I need space between logo and widget.

 Add following code in Theme Options -> Custom Styles: 
header .widget {float:right}

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How can I change the color of the call to action button on the main slider?

 Add following code in Theme Options -> Custom Styles: 
a.cycle_btn {
background-color:blue;
box-shadow: 0 1px 0 0 navy, 0 2px 0 0 navy, 0 3px 0 0 navy;
}

[totop] to Top [/totop]

How can I adjust the padding on the slider?

 Add following code in Theme Options -> Custom Styles: 
.bgimage { padding: 50px 0 60px; }
Also, you will need to change auto resize height values at /js/script.js search for: 110 and adjust it two times.
[totop] to Top [/totop]

item.title: Online Documentation
item.dc:creator: churchopewp
item.content:encoded:
Welcome

to the "ChurcHope" WordPress Theme Online Documentation

[clear]

THEME INSTALLATION

 The first step is installing your theme. There are two ways to install your theme and you need to choose the method which suits you most via WordPress dashboard or FTP. The easier method is via WordPress dashboard but there are certain situations when it is impossible so we are going to name both. [button type="simple_button_link" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/online-documentation/theme-installation/" target="" ]Install your WordPress theme[/button]


[two_third]

GENERAL & GLOBAL OPTIONS OVERVIEW


[one_fourth]
  • General
  • Header
  • Slideshow
  • Blog
  • Sidebars
  • Galleries
  • Events
[/one_fourth] [one_fourth last=last]
  • Testimonials
  • Footer
  • Custom Styles
  • reCaptcha
  • Theme Updater
  • Dummy Content
[/one_fourth][clear] [/two_third] [one_third last=last] [/one_third] [clear]

CONTENT SETUP


[one_third]

Pages

You can find all information about pages.From how to create page to how to setup different layouts, sidebars and even slideshow for page. [button type="simple_button_link" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/online-documentation/how-to-create-page/" target="" ]Setup Pages[/button]

Posts

You can find all information about post. From how to create post to how to create blog page to display your posts. [button type="simple_button_link" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/online-documentation/how-to-create-posts/" target="" ]Setup Posts[/button] [/one_third] [one_third]

Galleries

You can find all information about galleries. From how to create, to how to display your gallery posts in your theme using shortcodes and widgets. [button type="simple_button_link" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/online-documentation/how-to-create-gallery/" target="" ]Setup Galleries[/button]

Slideshows

You can find all information about slideshow. From how to create slideshow post to how to setups slideshow for pages/posts. [button type="simple_button_link" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/online-documentation/how-to-setup-slideshow/" target="" ]Setup Slideshow[/button] [/one_third] [one_third last=last]

Testimonials

You can find all information about testimonials. From how to create testimonials post to how to display testimonials in your theme. [button type="simple_button_link" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/online-documentation/how-to-create-testimonials/" target="" ]Setup Testimonials[/button]

Events

You can find all information about events, from how to create event post to how to display events in your theme using shortcodes and widgets. [button type="simple_button_link" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/how-to-events" target="" ]Setup Events[/button][/one_third] [clear]

SHORTCODES

 Shortcodes are integrated in default editor and you can add any of them in just a couple of clicks. So you dont need to remember all these shortcodes anymore. [button type="simple_button_link" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/online-documentation/how-to-use-shortcodes" target="" ]Learn how to Use the Shortcodes[/button]
[one_third]
  • Blog
  • Contact form Builder
  • Teasers
  • Gallery
  • Pricing plans
[/one_third] [one_third]
  • Social Links & Buttons
  • Notifications
  • Testimonials
  • Toggles
  • Tabs
[/one_third] [one_third last=last]
  • Events
  • Buttons
  • Slideshow Video
  • Columns
  • Other
[/one_third] [clear]

OTHER IMPORTANT STUFF
  • Sidebars & Widgets
  • Navigational menus
  • Theme Translation
  • Custom styles
  • Breadcrumbs


CUSTOMIZE THEME LOOK

 In this section we will talk about WordPress default theme customizer. This feature is available starting version 3.4 of WordPress. It allows you to customize theme options even before activating a new theme. [button type="simple_button_link" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/online-documentation/customize-theme-look/" target="" ]Customize my theme look[/button]

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTOINS

 We also have a FAQ section, where you can find answers to the most common questions. [button type="simple_button_link" url="http://churchope.themoholics.com/faq" target="" ]View FAQ[/button]

HELP FORUM

 Still have a questions? Well be glad to give you an answers at our help forum! [button type="simple_button_link" url="http://help.themoholics.com" target="" ]Help Forum[/button]

item.title: Events Global Settings
item.dc:creator: churchopewp
item.content:encoded:
[one_third]

Events Global Settings

 On the next image and in your dashboard you can see menu item called "Events" in "Theme Options". This is where you can setup some global settings for your events. [/one_third] [two_third last=last] [/two_third] [clear]

Introduction

 Using global settings you can set, lets say same layout and sidebar for all event posts that you will create. But you can always overwrite this setting for each post. There are lots of setting below the editor, or at the left side, when you edit events post. Check layout settings for event post. Note: To make global settings work you need to make sure that, for example, event post layout setting is set to Use global or Use global Sidebar

[totop] to Top [/totop]

Layout settings for events listing

 First two options controls position of sidebar for events listings and which instance of sidebars to use. Our theme is scalable and can be used with (Left Sidebar and Right Sidebar) or without sidebars (Full width).
Sidebar position for events listing - this option allows you to choose where the sidebar should be placed at events category pages: on the left, right side or completely removed (full width). Sidebar for events listing - select which of the sidebar you would like to use at events category pages. You can learn how to create sidebar here: Setup sidebars
[totop] to Top [/totop]

Layout settings for single event posts

 For single event post you can customize next options: Sidebar position for single event post - this option allows you to choose where the sidebar should be placed at events posts: on the left, right side or completely removed (full width). Sidebar for single event post - select which of the sidebar you would like to use at single event posts. You can learn how to create sidebar here: Setup sidebars
[notification type="notification_info_tiny"]You can overwrite global settings and set custom layout and sidebar for each event post[/notification]
[totop] to Top [/totop]

[one_half] [/one_half] [one_half last=last]

Map Settings

 This options allows you to set following options for google map on events pages:
Map types - Allow your readers to change the map type (street, satellite, or hybrid) Scroll wheel zoom - Enable zoom with the mouse scroll wheel Tooltips - Show marker titles as a "tooltip" on mouse-over Language - Use a specific for map controls (defaults - browser language). Read Google Maps API docs for more info.[/one_half] [clear]
[totop] to Top [/totop]

Custom Slugs

 Also you can set your custom slugs for events post and taxonomy.

[totop] to Top [/totop]

item.title: General Options
item.dc:creator: churchopewp
item.content:encoded:
[one_third]

General Settings

In General Settings you can find options related to the entire site such as fonts, favicon, content colors and more.
To edit general settings navigate to Theme Options -> General page at your Dashboard.[/one_third] [two_third last=last] [/two_third] [clear]



Choose a Font

You can change headings font for the whole website. Simply choose from hundreds of available google fonts from the dropdown.

[totop] to Top [/totop]

Check to disable Google Fonts

If you, for some reason, don't want to use google fonts, then you will want to turn on this option to disable it. After that default font will be used.

[totop] to Top [/totop]

Favicon URL

Favicon is a small icon that browsers use for your website to make it more recognizable, for example in your bookmarks or history. If a website has a favicon then you will usually see it to the left of the address bar or in browser tab. You need to type full URL to your favicon.ico (i.e.: http://Themoholics.com/images/favicon.ico)

[totop] to Top [/totop]

Disable login page styling

By default login page has our custom styling. If you want to disable it and switch to the default WordPress login page styling, simply turn on this option.

[totop] to Top [/totop]

Disable responsiveness

Our website has responsive design what means it change it look on different resolutions to improve usablility and also make it fully functional on devices. If you don't want it to change layout for different resolutions and stay fixed, then you can turn on this option.

[totop] to Top [/totop]

Color settings

This options allows you to choose colors for the following content (on the light background by default) elements: texts, headings and links.
[notification type="notification_info_tiny"] You can also edit colors for footer and header elements in Footer and Header settings, respectively. [/notification]
[totop] to Top [/totop]

item.title: Header Settings
item.dc:creator: churchopewp
item.content:encoded:
[one_third]

Header Settings

The Header tab holds options which are all about configuring your header part of website, including logo, top line, slideshow area and menu.
To edit Header settings navigate to Theme Options -> Header page at your Dashboard.[/one_third] [two_third last=last] [/two_third] [clear]



Use custom logo image

To use your own logo simply click "Choose file" button in the "Use custom logo image" block, then select to upload your logo image.

Hide logo image

In case you do not wish to use a logo you can hide it by setting "Hide logo image" option to "On".
[totop] to Top [/totop]

Use custom pattern image for header section

Here you can upload and set pattern image for the top line of the website, where the logo is located. Click "Choose file", browse for your pattern image and upload it.

Custom pattern settings

After you uploaded your pattern image, you can adjust it position and choose whether it will be repeatable or not.

[totop] to Top [/totop]

Use custom pattern image for color header section

Same as for logo area, you can set background image or pattern for slideshow and menu area. This image will be used for all website pages and can NOT be set specifically for each page.

Custom pattern settings

After you uploaded your pattern image, you can adjust it position and choose whether it will be repeatable or not.

[totop] to Top [/totop]

Call to action header ribbon URL

This field is responsible for the fancy call to action ribbon that you can find at the top of the website. You are able to set custom link to your ribbon, or remove ribbon. To remove call to action ribbon, simply leave this field completely empty, even without spaces!


Align menu to left

This option allows you to choose menu alignment. By default it aligned to the right side, but by turning On this option you can set left alignment for the menu.

[totop] to Top [/totop]

[clear] [one_half] [/one_half] [one_half last=last]

Header Color Settings

This options allows you to choose colors for the following header elements:
  1. Top (logo area) line background color
  2. Top line text color
  3. Slideshow and menu area background color
  4. Slideshow and menu text color

[totop] to Top [/totop] [/one_half] [clear]

How to change other theme Colors?

If you need to change some other colors you can check CSS Tweaks section in our FAQ.

item.title: Slideshow Settings
item.dc:creator: churchopewp
item.content:encoded:
[one_third]

Slideshow Settings

Using global settings you can set settings for slideshow that will be used by default for each page/post. You can set such settings as autoplay, pause, nevigation arrows, slideshow height, etc.
To edit slideshow settings navigate to Theme Options -> Slideshow page at your Dashboard.[/one_third] [two_third last=last] [/two_third] [clear]

Introduction

Using global settings you can set settings for slideshow that will be used by default for each page/post. So it is best to create global slideshow if you want to have same slideshow on every page of your website. But if you want to create different slideshow for different pages then you need to disbale slideshow in this settings and set it localy for each page/post. If you set slideshow localy in page settings, global slideshow options like category, how many slides to display, timeout, speed, etc. will be ignored and used from local page settings. To make global settings work you need to make sure that, for example, slideshow type in page/posts settings is set to Use global.
[totop] to Top [/totop]

Basic Slideshow Settings

To make slideshow work you need to set slideshow type and category. Our theme comes only with two slideshow types or custom Jcycle slideshow & Revolution, third option is to disbale slideshow. For Revolutions slideshow, you can choose which of slideshows to use. All other options at this page is fo JCycle slideshow only. To setup Revolution Slider navigate to Dashboard -> Revolution Slider For JCycle slideshow you need to choose what category to use and set how many slides to display. But note that all of these settings will be set only for global slideshow.

[totop] to Top [/totop]

Slideshow Timeout and Speed

Here you can set slideshow transition speed (speed of animation) and slideshow timeout (how long it will wait before switch to the next slide).

[totop] to Top [/totop]

Slideshow Pause and Autoplay

Set slideshow pause to "On" if you want slideshow to be paused when you roll mouse over slideshow. You can also turn on/off slideshow autoplay.

[totop] to Top [/totop]

Setting added in v 1.4 of our theme


Next, Previous navigation arrows

You can choose whether to show navigation arrows in slideshow or not. Arrows will be displayed only for high resolutions and will be replaced for devices.

Slideshow fixed height

Now you can make fixed height for slideshow easily by setting it height in pixels.

Remove top and bottom paddings from slideshow

This option is for those who don't like to waste space.

[totop] to Top [/totop]

Slideshow Slugs

You can set custom slugs for slideshow post and taxonomies.
[notification type="notification_info_tiny"] Other slideshow settings can be set when you create slides.[/notification]
[totop] to Top [/totop]

item.title: Blog Settings
item.dc:creator: churchopewp
item.content:encoded:
[one_third]

Blog Settings

In Blog Settings you can set global layout settings for the blog posts and listings, and some more.
To edit Blog settings navigate to Theme Options -> Blog page at your Dashboard.[/one_third] [two_third last=last] [/two_third] [clear]


Blog Listing Sidebar Settings

First two options controls position of sidebar for blog listings (blog, category, tag, search result, archive listings.) and which instance of sidebars to use. Our theme is scalable and can be used with or without sidebars.
Sidebar position for blog listing - where the sidebar should be placed: at the left, right side or completely removed (full width). Sidebar for blog listing - select which of the sidebar you would like to use at blog page. You can learn how to create sidebar here: Setup sidebars
[totop] to Top [/totop]

Blog Posts Sidebar Settings

Same as for the blog page, you can control position of sidebar for post page and set what instance of sidebars to use. Our theme scalable and can be used with or without sidebars.
Sidebar position for single post - where the sidebar should be placed: at the left, right side or completely removed (full width). Sidebar for single post - select which of the sidebar you would like to use at single post page. You can learn how to create sidebar here: Setup sidebars
[totop] to Top [/totop]

Additional

Check to disable excerpts on blog listing - this option allow to swith from excerts to full content for blog listings. Disable author box - this option removes author box from post page.

[totop] to Top [/totop]

Options that was added in version 1.8

Check to hide date for post - this option allow turn off square with date on the blog listing. Disable thumbnail for blog listing, categories, etc. - this option removes thumbnail from blog listings.

[totop] to Top [/totop]

item.title: Testimonials Settings
item.dc:creator: churchopewp
item.content:encoded:
[one_third]

Testimonials Settings

In Testimonials Settings you can set global layout settings for the testimonials posts and listings, and some more.
To edit Testimonials settings navigate to Theme Options -> Testimonials page at your Dashboard.[/one_third] [two_third last=last] [/two_third] [clear]


Testimonials Listing Sidebar Settings

First two options controls position of sidebar for testimonials listings and which instance of sidebars to use. Our theme is scalable and can be used with or without sidebars.
Sidebar position for testimonials listing - where the sidebar should be placed: at the left, right side or completely removed (full width). Sidebar for testimonials listing - select which of the sidebar you would like to use at testimonials page. You can learn how to create sidebar here: Setup sidebars
[totop] to Top [/totop]

Testimonials Posts Sidebar Settings

Same as for the testimonials page, you can control position of sidebar for post page and set what instance of sidebars to use. Our theme scalable and can be used with or without sidebars.

[totop] to Top [/totop]

Testimonials Slugs

You can set custom slugs for testimonials post and taxonomies.
[totop] to Top [/totop]

item.title: Sidebars Settings
item.dc:creator: churchopewp
item.content:encoded:
[one_third]

Sidebar Settings

With the sidebar tab you can create custom sidebars to use throughout your pages and posts.
To create/delete sidebars navigate to Theme Options -> Sidebars page at your Dashboard.[/one_third] [two_third last=last] [/two_third] [clear]

Adding a new sidebar

Simply type name for your sidebar and click "Add sidebar". For the sidebar names you are allowed to use uppercase, lowercase, numbers and underscores. Wordpress does not allow other characters or symbols so if you try to use them they will be stripped out.
After you created a new sidebar it will be listed below. You can always delete it by clicking delete button.

[totop] to Top [/totop]

[one_half]

Using your new sidebar

When editing your pages and posts there will be an option called "Sidebar" in "Layout Type" block. You can choose your custom sidebar here to use with that specific page or post. [/one_half] [one_half last=last] [/one_half] [clear] Also there is additional widget area between the map and content on pages. You can set custom sidebar for this area.
After creating your custom sidebars you need to add some widgets to them. Navigate to Appearance -> Widgets and you can find your new sidebars at the bottom of the list on the right side.
[totop] to Top [/totop]

item.title: Galleries settings
item.dc:creator: churchopewp
item.content:encoded:
[one_third]

Galleries Settings

In Galleries Settings you can set global layout settings for the gallery posts and listings, and some more.
To edit Galleries settings navigate to Theme Options -> Galleries page at your Dashboard.[/one_third] [two_third last=last] [/two_third] [clear]


Galleries Listing Sidebar Settings

First two options controls position of sidebar for Galleries listings and which instance of sidebars to use. Our theme is scalable and can be used with or without sidebars.
Sidebar position for galleries listing - where the sidebar should be placed: at the left, right side or completely removed (full width). Sidebar for galleries listing - select which of the sidebar you would like to use at gallery listing page. You can learn how to create sidebar here: Setup sidebars
[totop] to Top [/totop]

Gallery Posts Sidebar Settings

You can control position of sidebar for gallery post page and set what instance of sidebars to use. Our theme is scalable and can be used with or without sidebars.
Sidebar position for single gallery - where the sidebar should be placed: at the left, right side or completely removed (full width). Sidebar for single gallery - select which of the sidebar you would like to use at single gallery post page. You can learn how to create sidebar here: Setup sidebars
[totop] to Top [/totop]

Gallery Slugs

You can set custom slugs for gallery post and taxonomies.

[totop] to Top [/totop]

Custom Icons for galery post listing

Our theme comes with different icons, such as: plus, magnifier, text, microphone etc. They can be set near the title at gallery listing page to give more idea what inside of the gallery post. Using this option you can upload your own icons.

[totop] to Top [/totop]

item.title: Footer Settings
item.dc:creator: churchopewp
item.content:encoded:
[one_third]

Footer Settings

Footer tab holds options which are all about configuring your footer part of website, such as: widgets area, colors, footer text. Also this is where you can add your google analytics code.
To edit Footer settings navigate to Theme Options -> Footer page at your Dashboard.[/one_third] [two_third last=last] [/two_third] [clear]



Footer widget area

You can have one widget area in footer with 1-4 columns. You can choose between how many columns you want by selecting number from "columns number for footer widget area" drop down. Columns will be stretched to cover the full width of footer area. I.E.: If you have a single widget it will be stretched to the full footer width, if you got 2 widgets, each of them will cover a 50% of a footer width. You can disable the whole row of widgets in footer by switching off "Enable footer widget area" option.

Image below shows you example of footer widget area with 4 columns.

At the image below you can see Footer colums sidebars in Appearance->Widgets. This is where you need to place your widgets in order to see them in footer widget area.
[totop] to Top [/totop]

Footer text

You can setup your footer text (copyrights, disclamer, etc.), which is going to be shown on the left side of the footer.
[totop] to Top [/totop]

Google Analytics

You can add your Google Analytics code here. Sign up for free at http://www.google.com/analytics/. After setting up your account you will be given a tracking code.
[totop] to Top [/totop]

[two_third] [/two_third] [one_third last=last]


Footer colors options

This options allows you to choose colors for footer elements.
The image below shows what element control each color option from the image on the left. But you can also change color and other settings for any element using "Custom Styles" section in "Theme Options". Check for the needed code in "CSS Tweaks" section of our FAQ.


[totop] to Top [/totop] [/one_third]

How to change other theme Colors?

If you need to change some other colors you can check CSS Tweaks section in our FAQ.

item.title: Theme Installation
item.dc:creator: churchopewp
item.content:encoded:
Introduction


Theme was made for Wordpress 3.4 and newer versions. Make sure that you're not using version below 3.4, otherwise upgrade your Wordpress version if it is possible ( http://codex.wordpress.org/Updating_WordPress ). In two words, you need to upload "Churchope" folder from our archive to your hosting into wp-content/themes directory (wp-content/themes/churchope that's how it should be look like). Or you can use "Install theme" function from dashboard and choose for upload "churchope.zip" that located at root of our archive. After that activate Theme from Wordpress admin panel by clicking " Themes" in "Appearance" section, which is located on the left side. After activation you'll be redirected to your theme settings page. More detailed instruction below.


Installation:


First of all you choose the method which suits you most via WP dashboard or FTP. The easier method is via WP dashboard but there are certain situations when it is impossible so we are going to name both.

1.

Installation via FTP


a) Use the simple download-extract scheme for the theme. There is an important point here: be sure you keep the original structure of the directories after decompressing the archive. Most often the authors of the theme add guidelines for installation. Follow them. b) Most often a theme archive already contains needed structure of directories ready to upload your theme on your host web server after extracting. Upload to wp-content/themes/ folder with theme files on your host web server using an FTP client to access. c) Transfer the extracted theme files.

There are two ways of getting files onto your site, and once there, changing them. By using your cPanel, or whatever file manager is provided by your host. By using an FTP or SFTP client. You can learn how to use FileZilla here.
[totop] to Top [/totop]

2.

Installation via WP dashboard


a) Installation of the Theme via WP dashboard starts naturally with logging on to the WP administration panel. b) Select Appearances at the left panel and then choose Themes.
c) Click Install Themes. d) Press Upload in the upper sub menu to install downloaded earlier archive of your Theme.

[totop] to Top [/totop]

The final step is Activation


1. Enter the WP Administration Panel in your blog 2. Select the name or a screenshot of a Theme you wanted to activate in Appearances panel/Themes.
3. A preview window with your theme will open. Check if it looks properly. 4. You will see Save & Activate + name of your theme in the upper left corner.
5. Activation complete.
[notification type="notification_mark_tiny"]After installing theme you get clean WordPress installation. But our theme also comes with dummy content! Theme Options -> Dummy content[/notification] [notification type="notification_warning_tiny"]Warning! DO NOT INSTALL dummy data on your live website. It will corrupt your existing data. We suggest you install dumy data only on clean WordPress setup.[/notification]
[totop] to Top [/totop]


Known problems when installing the theme


1.

The Broken theme and/or stylesheets missing error is most common when you install or activate a new theme.


However that doesnt necessarily mean that the theme was actually broken or the so important part is missing. It would rather mean that the theme was just uploaded to the server incorrectly and missing stylesheets are not missing but got to the wrong folder when downloading and unzipping. Here are some tips how to fix that: a. After downloading and unzipping open the final theme folder. Inside there will be the actual theme folder. The actual theme folder is where the style.css file is. b. You must upload only the actual theme folder to your WordPress host. Our advice is to double check. c. Enter your WordPress admin panel and activate your new theme. Summing up, the destination /wp-content/themes/themename/themename/style.css is incorrect and is the reason of Broken theme and/or stylesheets missing error message. It must look like /wp-content/themes/themename/style.css
[totop] to Top [/totop]

2.

Problems with uploading via WP admin panel due Upload limit.


You may check your file upload limit on Your Media Uploader page in WordPress. Depending upon the web hosting company and the conditions of the service they provide it may vary. The most common is about 8 MB which is more or less enough. But uploading some media files like audio and video may become a problem with for example 2 MB upload limit.
We decided to share some tips about how to extend your maximum file upload size in WordPress:
1. Through functions.php file: You may add the below mentioned code in the functions.php file of your theme 
@ini_set( 'upload_max_size' , '64M' );
@ini_set( 'post_max_size', '64M');
@ini_set( 'max_execution_time', '300' );

2. Through PHP.INI file: If you cannot see the php.ini file in your directory create the new one with below mentioned code and upload it to your root folder on your web server. If you can see the php.ini file then change parameters or add : 
upload_max_filesize = 64M
post_max_size = 64M 
max_execution_time = 300
In case that tip does not work with 64MB, try it with 10MB.
3. Through .htaccess method You may try modifying the existing .htaccess file in the root directory or creating a new one. Add the following code in the existing or new htacess file: 
php_value upload_max_filesize 64M 
php_value post_max_size 64M 
php_value max_execution_time 300 
php_value max_input_time 300
You can reset all of the setting for the each page on our custom panel by clicking "Reset" button on the bottom.
[totop] to Top [/totop]

item.title: Custom Styles
item.dc:creator: churchopewp
item.content:encoded:
[one_third]

Custom Styles

Custom Styles option allows you to add custom CSS rules from admin panel instead of editing core theme files.
To add Custom Styles navigate to Theme Options -> Custom Styles page at your Dashboard.[/one_third] [two_third last=last] [/two_third] [clear]


You can add custom CSS rules from admin panel.

It allows you to change theme look without editing core theme files, intead of editing core theme files. And what is important, CSS rules are stored in database and will be saved after theme update.

Dummy Content Install
